locutie.beschrijving: A thematic exposition of Jeremiah's psychological state, the corruption of the human heart, and the transition to the New Covenant.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-thematic overview; focuses on the 'operating system' of the Old Testament.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of human sin and the historical fulfillment of the New Covenant in Christ.
voorbeelden: I seek to share an abiding love for the greatness of the Bible.
The New Testament simply does not work without the Old Testament.
Everything is changed for us.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Hearers should recognize their own corruption and find comfort in the historical fact of the New Covenant.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentions the Spirit's intention in the shape of the biblical book, but less so in the act of preaching itself.

voorbeelden: Jeremiah shows us his heart.
The book of Jeremiah is very difficult to teach.
There is a vast disruption in the creation.
Note how his moods change.
Let us hold in our minds the picture of the human heart.
Do not ask for whom the bell tolls.
I have come to believe...
I know I can't [stand up to judgment].
How Jeremiah must have rejoiced!
I will put my law within them.
I will be their God.
There is a new promise written in the blood of Christ.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High biblical fidelity, but often framed as 'talking about' the promise rather than 'delivering' it directly.

voorbeelden: Everything is changed for us.
I am a creature of the New Covenant.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate; the preacher declares the state of the believer based on the text.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 3rd person historical narrative.
Lengthy cultural analysis of celebrities (Britney Spears, Tiger Woods).
Theological lecturing on the relationship between OT and NT.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement and self-reflection, but potentially lacking the 'event' of being addressed by God.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise (Toezegging) in the 2nd person.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer remains an observer of the 'Human Dilemma' rather than a participant in the 'Divine Solution'.

voorbeelden: Everything is changed for us.
There is a new promise written in the blood of Christ.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal experience and teaching methodology.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Limited; mostly used to implicate the hearer in sin.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant; describing Jeremiah, Israel, and cultural figures.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about the human heart.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Human corruption) -> Directive (We must understand this).
voorbeelden: The human heart is desperately corrupt... Here is the challenge for us: No matter how upright our lives may appear, we share in the human condition.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Creates a moral weight without immediate sacramental relief.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Jeremiah 31) -> Commissive (Promise in Christ) -> Directive (Walk as New Covenant creatures).
voorbeelden: In the Cross of Christ... a transaction of unimaginable grace has taken place... And so the next time we are tempted... we can say 'I am a creature of the New Covenant'.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but delayed until the very end.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: I am a creature of the New Covenant... [therefore] I can say to myself...
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The prophets and apostles summon us to an understanding of this reality [of sin].

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a high-level theological and psychological lecture on the human condition and the biblical narrative structure.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The Old Testament is the operating system of the New.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a strong intellectual framework for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy descriptions of Britney Spears and Eliot Spitzer.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Distant from the immediate sacramental encounter.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is more of a 'talk about' God than an 'act of' God, though the conclusion approaches an event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher describes the 'transaction' of grace but does not performatively 'hand it over' to the listener in the moment.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is quoted (Jeremiah 31), but the preacher speaks mostly as an observer.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a teacher/professor than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I seek to share an abiding love for the greatness of the Bible.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, regarding the canonization of Scripture.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicit; the preacher hopes the 'words filled with power' will work.
tekstueel_bewijs: the shape of the book as we have it is part of the Holy Spiritâ€™s intention.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon points to the Eucharist as the means of grace rather than being one itself.
tekstueel_bewijs: This cup is the new covenant in my blood.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 3rd person past tense (Jeremiah was) to 2nd person present tense (Christ is for you).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: In the Cross of Christ... a transaction of unimaginable grace and mercy has taken place.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the Cross of Christ, God has forgiven you and claimed you as His own.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical fact to a present declarative event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is described as a 'plan and purpose' rather than delivered as a gift.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use direct address 'To you is promised...'
voorbeeldzinnen: To you, whose heart feels the weight of this dilemma, God promises: I will write my law on your heart.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the clergy/lay leaders directly in their specific calling.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the signs planted by God in this world.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The foundation is actually quite good, just buried in information.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Shorten the cultural 'constative' section to allow the 'indicative' of grace more room to breathe.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply thoughtful and orthodox sermon that would gain immense sacramental power by shifting from 'talking about the heart' to 'speaking to the heart' in the name of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (sharing his love for the Bible); SAT focuses on whether the 'New Covenant' is actually enacted in the room.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the use of the 'tree' metaphor; SAT asks if the metaphor functions as a Commissive (God binding Himself to the hearer).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that despite the beautiful language, the sermon remains largely in the 'Assertive' mode, which risks leaving the hearer as an informed spectator rather than a redeemed participant.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The heart is deceitful above all things.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Exposition' where the 'event' is located in the biblical text's history rather than the preaching moment.
